title: Sambal kacang (peanut sauce)

ingredients.content: 4 - 7 dried red chillies, deseeded, to taste
2 ½ cm piece fresh ginger, peeled
2 ½ cm piece fresh galangal, peeled

preparations.content: Place chillies into a bowl, cover with warm water and set aside to soak for 5 minutes to soften.
Place peanuts into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer into a separate bowl and set aside.

Using simmering basket, drain chillies. Place oil, eschalots, garlic, ginger, galangal, lemongrass, candlenuts and drained chillies into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved peanuts and sauté <b>8 min/120°C/speed 2<b>.
Add tamarind paste, water, palm sugar and salt and cook <b>8 min/100°C/speed 2<b>. Serve as dipping sauce with meat or vegetable dishes, compressed rice cakes or satay.

hintsAndTricks: You can find candlenuts at most Asian food stores or speciality food stores.
You can store this sauce in a sealable container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
